results.title: Hitler: the road to revenge
results.creator_credit: Don Thompson, New York Times Productions and Nielsen-Ferns
results.brief_description: Shows how Hitler’s personality, and the social, political and economic conditions in the 1930’s, played a large role in his rise to power. Also indicates the means by which he achieved power: mass psychology, propaganda and physical violence. Narrated by Henry Fonda. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Don Thompson, New York Times Productions and Nielsen-Ferns

results.title: The Uncalculated risk
results.creator_credit: Filmspace Productions and Russ Nichols Productions
results.brief_description: Shows what can go wrong when inexperienced people head down river in canoes, rafts and kayaks. Stresses that prior instruction is the best means of preventing accidents.

results.title: Margin for error
results.brief_description: Shows the open Canadian and kayak events in a series of white-water touring shots. Points out the factors that are needed for safe canoeing and highlights rescue techniques.

results.title: Creating with ceramics
results.creator_credit: David Hubbard, Dick Hoffman, Tom Hubbard and Crystal
results.brief_description: Provides an introduction to the techniques of clay gathering, mixing, wedging, throwing, glazing and firing by showing three potters creating three pieces, each of a different style.

results.title: I can make music
results.creator_credit: Tom Zubrycki, Ursula Kolbe and New South Wales Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Shows various methods of working with children, including the Orff method, which involves young children in actively responding to music. Highlights movement to music and the music of different cultures from places such as Mexico and South America. Suitable for teacher/tertiary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tom Zubrycki, Ursula Kolbe and New South Wales Film Corporation

results.title: A Scrap of paper and a piece of string
results.creator_credit: John Korty and Exploring for the National Broadcasting Company
results.brief_description: An animated film about a scrap of paper which boasts of being more useful than a piece of string. However, after turning into a paper boat and getting blown over in the water, the paper finds the string of use after all. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: Noddy goes to school
results.creator_credit: Brian Cosgrove, Mark Hall, CPL and Stop Frame Productions
results.brief_description: Based on the Noddy stories by Enid Blyton. A series of incidents cause Noddy to come to the realisation that he should go to school to learn to read. Narrated by Richard Briers.

results.title: Thomas Hardy: a man who noticed things
results.brief_description: A dramatised documentary about the life and loves of Thomas Hardy. Narrated by Charles Causley, the film looks at Hardy’s love for his home and family, his suffering for animals, his delight in both secular and sacred music, and his notorious love affairs. Illustrates how Hardy’s work related directly to such aspects of his life. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Invitation to archery
results.creator_credit: American Archery Council and Athletic Institute
results.brief_description: Explores the history of archery and examines modern equipment available. Includes segments on target shooting, field archery, bot hunting and fishing. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: Shortspell
results.creator_credit: Stuart Wynn Jones and Kinetic Film Enterprises
results.brief_description: An animated review of the alphabet in which each letter becomes a picture and each picture becomes the next letter. Both sound and picture are drawn directly onto the film by the artist.
